meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unsociable or antisocial.
meanings.sent1: Her insociability made it difficult for her to make friends at school.
meanings.sent2: His insociability often led to misunderstandings with his coworkers.
meanings.sent3: Despite his insociability, he found solace in the company of his books.
meanings.sent4: The insociability of the old house gave it a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The insociability of the cat made it clear that it preferred solitude.

meanings.definition: The tendency to avoid social interactions or relationships.
meanings.sent1: The insociability of the shy student was evident during group activities.
meanings.sent2: His insociability was often misunderstood as aloofness by others.
meanings.sent3: The insociability of the recluse became a topic of neighborhood gossip.
meanings.sent4: The insociability of the lone wolf was a source of admiration for some.
meanings.sent5: The insociability of the introverted artist fueled her creativity.
